intro: Nivenia concava, commonly known as the concave nivenia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in rocky or alpine habitats where it forms dense clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Nivenia concava is considered a vulnerable species.
